definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: The influence of both Roman and Byzantine traditions is evident in the architecture of the Romanesque period.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬式建築顯然受到了羅馬帝國和拜占庭傳統的影響。

sentences.english: The images were Gothic or Byzantine rather than classical.
sentences.chinese: 這些形象屬哥特式或者拜占庭式而非古典式。

sentences.english: Crusaders declaring war on Byz every time they pass their lands fixed.
sentences.chinese: 十字軍向拜占庭宣戰，修正了他們的行走路線。

sentences.english: There's been hundreds of deities like Apamea throughout the Empire of Byzantium.
sentences.chinese: 幾百個像阿帕梅亞的城市遍佈於拜占庭帝國。

sentences.english: Both basilicas also have in common a neo-Byzantine style and hilltop site.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個教堂也有共同的一個新拜占庭風格和山頂站點。

sentences.english: The empire was left only Constantinople and the Morea.
sentences.chinese: 拜占庭帝國現在僅存君士坦丁堡和摩里亞地區。

sentences.english: To the holy city of Byzantium .
During this time, the Byzantine mosaic entered its flourishing Period.
sentences.chinese: 這段時間是拜占庭鑲嵌畫的盛期。

sentences.english: The Byzantines loved ivory. They thought it had a texture like living skin.
sentences.chinese: 拜占庭人酷愛象牙，他們認爲它的質地像皮膚。

sentences.english: They wear padded or mail armour and are equipped with a composite bow and sword.
sentences.chinese: 拜占庭騎兵身穿鑲甲或鍊甲，裝備複合弓和長劍。

sentences.english: The cathedral features the ancient art of Byzantine mosaics.
sentences.chinese: 這種大教堂具有拜占庭式的馬賽克古代藝術的特徵。

pinyin: Shen2 sheng4 Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2

definition: Sassanid Empire of Persia (c. 2nd-7th century AD)
Umayyad Empire (661-750, in Iberia -1031), successor of the Rashidun caliphate
Abbasid Empire (750-1258), successor of the Umayyad caliphate
Bokhara or Bukhara city in Uzbekistan
